packages.excerpt: This library written by Artyom Beilis enables backtraces on your exceptions.A bunch of overloads of the standard exceptions types are provided, as well as tools to walk theirtraces when thrown.
Beast based library providing [Crails::Server] and the Request Pipeline,listening on an interfa...
Provides a router for requests on the server-side, dispatchingrequests to your callbacks according to an HTTP request path.
Integrates libtext-archive into Crails with a [Crails::RequestParser] and a [Crails::Renderer].
Helps you store files in a local storage and assign them to models.
Simple Captcha generator with support for custom captchas using libcapt or reCAPTCHA.
Shared utilities used by the Command Line Interface tools for the Crails Framework.
Controller layer for Crails' MVC design. It builds on libcrails-action to use acontroller interface and method pointers instead of plain callbacks.
Cookie-based [SessionStore].
Helper classes for CRUD related designs.
Database-agnostic configuration and connection management for your databases. Speeds upyour response time by sharing a single database connection for requests coming fromthe same thread.
OpenSSL based classes for encryption.
Loads application/x-www-form-urlencoded request bodies into [Crails::Params] with an implementation of [Crails::RequestParser].
Implements [Crails::Renderer] and [Crails::Template] for HTML documents, including several helpers for building formHTML templates can be generated using the ecpp generator:
Beast based library providing HTTP clients with both synchronous and asynchronous request support.
Helps you store and transform image files in a local storage and assign them to models, using libcrails-attachment and ImageMagick.
Loads application/json request bodies into [Crails::Params] with an implementation of [Crails::RequestParser].
Implements [Crails::Renderer] and [Crails::Template] for JSON documents, including a Domain-Specific Language for generating JSON with the ecpp generator:
Logger and log rotation tools.
Sends email using SMTP or MailGrid.
Loads multipart/form-data request bodies into [Crails::Params] with an implementation of [Crails::RequestParser].
OAuth support for libcrails-signin. Includes implementations for Google, Live (Microsoft) and Facebook.

Provides an implementation of [Crails::RequestHandler] proxyfing queries according to a custom set of static rules. See the [Crails::ProxyRequestHandler] class and [Crails::ProxyRequestHandler::Rule] struct for more details.
Small toolbox for generating random strings of characters.
Efficient file-reading made simple with the Crails::read_file function.

Provides the [Crails::Renderer] and [Crails::RenderTarget] interfaces. Applications can then register renderers for various Content-Type target, and for each of those, register a series of [Crails::Renderer::Generator] callbacks.
Provides a template class for building URL mapping through a routing system, with our own custom URL parameter and callback types.
Implements [Crails::Rnederer] and [Crails::Template] for RSS documents, using XML templates generated using the ecpp generator:

String manipulation library, providing a set of functions for splitting, joining strings,base64 encoding and decoding, but also functions to convert strings to a case style (camel-case, snake-case, kebab-case).
Adds error monitoring by capturing exceptions and sending them to a Sentry server.

Simple background jobs system. It's designed with simplicity in mind, but can also become more efficient and reliable when paired with a Redis database. Brings tools to simply write tasks separated from your Crails application, scheduling their executio...
Object-Oriented wrapper for libssh with stream redirection.
Toolset for real-time communication between client and server, using WebSockets.
Provides the [Crails::Template] class, used as a base for classes generated by the ecpp template system.
Components for writing and running a test suite.
Loads URL query parameters into [Crails::Params] with an implementation of [Crails::RequestParser].
Loads application/xml or text/xml request bodies into [Crails::Params] with an implementation of [Crails::RequestParser] leveraging boost::property_tre...

Implements client and server tools for the XML-RPC protocol, allowing you to perform queries to XML-RPC services, or to implement an XML-RPC endpoint that integrates into your Crails router and control...
Loads YAML request bodies into [Crails::Params] with an implementation of [Crails::RequestParser] using yaml-cpp.

Libdatatree provides types to dynamically create, walk and edit nested trees of values. [DataTree] and [Data] allow safely walking over nodes, independently of whether they actually exist or not. Each branch can then be converted to arbitrary types (str...
Text-based serializer, providing a concise way to exchange messages over HTTP, with an Object-Oriented API making it easy to serialize and unserialize:

classes.name: FileCache
classes.excerpt: Loads file from the filesystem, and caches them until garbage_collect is called. The [FileCache::Lock] class should be usedas a scope guard to ensure thread...

classes.name: Context
classes.excerpt: The Context object is at the core of the Crails Framework, and represents a Request/Response transaction with an HTTP client. It provides both a [Params] and a [BuildingResponse] as attributes, so you can inspect the content of a request, a...

classes.name: Server
classes.excerpt: The central piece of the framework. Listens on a given hostname and port, accepts connections and dispatches them to a [Context].

classes.name: ExceptionCatcher
classes.excerpt: Dynamic try/catch mechanism. Define catch blocks using [std::function], then run protected code anywhere else in your application.

classes.name: DataTree
classes.excerpt: The DataTree class provides a data structure that stores an arbitrarily deeply nested tree of values, indexed at each level by some key. Each node of the tree stores its own value, or a list of subnodes and their keys.

classes.name: Data
classes.excerpt: Represents a node in a [DataTree], and allows evaluating, modifying the content of the node, or exploring its children.

classes.name: Params
classes.excerpt: Represents the parameters of an HTTP query as an arbitrarily deeply neested tree of values. Params extends on the [DataTree] class, using the same API to access its contents.

classes.name: RequestParser
classes.excerpt: Interface for request parsers. Request parsers are functors which receive a [Context] and a callback as parameters.

classes.name: RequestHandler
classes.excerpt: Interface for request handlers. Request handlers are functors which receive a [Context] and a callback as parameters.

classes.name: Connection
classes.excerpt: Represents a connection with an HTTP client. When a query is received, the connection instantiates a [Context] and let it run the query through the Request Pipeline.

classes.name: BuildingResponse
classes.excerpt: Represents the transient state of an HTTP repsonse that may be sent to a client at any moment. It wraps a [HttpResponse] object, and can progressively edit it until the send method gets called.

classes.name: SessionStore
classes.excerpt: Interface for SessionStore backends, providing session data based on cookies - or anything else depending on the implementation.

classes.name: ActionRequestHandler
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [RequestHandler] interface that forwards queries to the [Router], and exists the Request Pipeline if the router was able to trigger an action from t...

classes.name: BodyParser
classes.excerpt: Interface for [RequestParser] implementations that need the body of an [HttpRequest] to be available before performing their task.

classes.name: RequestMultipartParser
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [RequestParser] interface that parses variables from a request body provided using the multipart/form-data format, typically used for sending HTML forms including files.

classes.name: File
classes.excerpt: Represents a file uploaded by the client request.

classes.name: RenderTarget
classes.excerpt: Interface for targets of a [Renderer]. A render target can be a file, a string, an HTTP response, a mail.

classes.name: RenderString
classes.excerpt: A [RenderTarget] implementation that stores rendered content into a string, which you can then access as a [std::string_view] using the value method, or as const char* using the c_str method.

classes.name: NullPointerException
classes.excerpt: Thrown by [safe_ptr] when trying to dereference a null pointer.

classes.name: safe_ptr
classes.excerpt: Convenience implementation of [std::shared_ptr] that avoid crashes when trying to dereference null pointers. Instead of triggering undefined behaviors, trying to dereference a null pointer using safe_ptr will throw a [NullPointerException]....

classes.name: WebSocket
classes.excerpt: Represents an on-going connection with a WebSocket.

classes.name: NoSessionStore
classes.excerpt: Stub implementation for [SessionStore] that doesn't store or load any session variables.

classes.name: ProgramOptions
classes.excerpt: Parses an argument list (int argc, const char** argv) for a Crails server and provides an easy interface to consult each of the option. Based on boost::program_op...

classes.name: LogRotate
classes.excerpt: Manages the output of the [Logger], handling an history of log files, and swapping the current log files to new ones at launch, or possibly at runtime.

classes.name: LogFiles
classes.excerpt: Initializes [LogRotate] for a Crails application using the options defined for the Crails [Server]. It can be initialized with [ProgramOptions] for a more direct approach, or with int argc, const char** argv for implementations that merely ...

classes.name: FileRequestHandler
classes.excerpt: Implementation of [RequestHandler] that tries to respond to a query by looking up files in the application's public directory (matching a [Server]'s public_path attribute).

classes.name: Url
classes.excerpt: Represents a URL using the HTTP scheme, providing an easy way to access the host, port, and path of an URL.

classes.name: Listener
classes.excerpt: Listener used by the [Server] class. Listens on a network interface and port, accepts new connections and dispatches them to a [Connection] object.

classes.name: RouterBase
classes.excerpt: RouterBase is a template allowing you to quickly build routing systems for your application.

classes.name: ActionRoute
classes.excerpt: Route handler for controllers based on the [ActionController].

classes.name: ActionController
classes.excerpt: ActionController is the basis for all the controllers from the libcrails-controllers module. It brings a simple MVC API to interact with [Crails::Context] and populates its [Crails::BuildingResponse] before it is sent to the cl...

classes.name: WebSocketRoute
classes.excerpt: Route handler for [WebSocket].

classes.name: Renderer
classes.excerpt: Interface and helpers for Renderers. A Renderer is an object used to attempt to try and render templates matching a given mimetype format.

classes.name: MissingTemplate
classes.excerpt: Exception thrown when a [Renderer] was requested to render a [Template] that does not exist.

classes.name: RequestArchiveParser
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [RequestParser] interface designed to intercept requests using the crails/archive format. The archive's content will be stored in the [Params] object under the archive_data key.

classes.name: Attachment
classes.excerpt: Represents a file in a persistent storage. The reference to that file can be stored in database using a string of characters.

classes.name: WithPath
classes.excerpt: Scope guard temporarily changing the application's current directory to a given [std::filesystem::path].

classes.name: Command
classes.excerpt: Interface for implementing commands and sub-commands in Crails CLI applications.

classes.name: Notifier
classes.excerpt: Interface for helpers used by terminal applications to send notifications to the user. Possible implementations are [TerminalNotifier], [KDialogNotifier] or [NotifySendNotifier].

classes.name: KDialogNotifier
classes.excerpt: Implements [Notifier]. Triggers notifications using KDialog, if available on the system.

classes.name: NotifySendNotifier
classes.excerpt: Implements [Notifier]. Display notifications to the terminal user using notify-send.

classes.name: TerminalNotifier
classes.excerpt: Implements [Notifier]. Implements [Notifier]. Typical last case scenario for sending notifications for terminal applications: when no other methods are available, just printing a message on the terminal will do the trick.

classes.name: CommandIndex
classes.excerpt: A CLI command that indexes and allow the user to pick a sub-command.

classes.name: BasicAuthenticationController
classes.excerpt: The basic authentication controller brings HTTP Basic Authentication to your controllers. It is typically used through the [Crails::Controller] class, which inherits this cla...

classes.name: CsrfController
classes.excerpt: Controller component providing tools to implement protection against Cross-Site Request Forgery.When enabled, it will create a variable into the session [Data] object p...

classes.name: RenderController
classes.excerpt: Controller component that renders content to a [BuildingResponse] using a [Renderer]. While the RenderController is mostly designed to provide a simple API for rendering view templates, it also provides helpers to set a response's body from...

classes.name: CookieData
classes.excerpt: Extends on [DataTree], adding method to serialize and unserialize its contents in or from a cookie. If use_encryption is set to true, the cookie's contents will be encrypted using AES-256.

classes.name: CookieStore
classes.excerpt: Implementation of [SessionStore] based on cookies. Session variables are stored within the Cookie and Set-Cookie headers.

classes.name: Databases
classes.excerpt: Initializes and maintains a connection to remote databases represented by the [Database] interface, in a multi-threading friendly fashion. Instances of [Database] are created for each thread as soon as they are required, and are maintained until the thr...

classes.name: Database
classes.excerpt: Interface for database implementations managed by the [Databases] class.

classes.name: Logger
classes.excerpt: Handles logging for Crails applications. Each log is provided with a log_level. The logger is thread-safe, and can aggregate the logs from several threads into a single [std::ostream].

classes.name: DatabaseUrl
classes.excerpt: Parses a database URL and provides an easy access to each individual fragment through the type, hostname, username, password and database_name attributes.

classes.name: MessageDigest
classes.excerpt: Simple interface for encrypting [std::string] using OpenSSL.

classes.name: HmacDigest
classes.excerpt: HMAC is a MAC (message authentication code) involving a cryptographic hash function and a secret cryptographic key. It may be used b...

classes.name: HmacMd5Digest
classes.excerpt: Checks the authenticity of a message using the HMAC-MD5 algorithm. See [HmacDigest] for more details.

classes.name: RequestFormParser
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [RequestParser] interface that parses variables from a request body provided using the application/x-www-urlencoded format, typically used for sending HTML forms.

classes.name: HtmlRenderer
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [Renderer] interface for HTML documents.

classes.name: Template
classes.excerpt: Base class for templates that may be rendered by a [Renderer].

classes.name: HtmlTemplate
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [Template] class for HTML documents. When writing HTML templates for ecpp, you should consider that the contents of your template will be implementing the HtmlTemplate

classes.name: FormBuilder
classes.excerpt: Helper class generating HTML forms for Models. The FormBuilder template class creates <form> and its <input> elements with scoped names.

classes.name: ClientInterface
classes.excerpt: Common components for the HTTP [Client] and [Ssl::Client] classes.

classes.name: Client
classes.excerpt: HTTP client allowing you to send HTTP queries using the same [boost::asio::io_context] as your [Crails::Server].

classes.name: Client
classes.excerpt: HTTP client allowing you to send HTTPS queries using the same [boost::asio::io_context] as your [Crails::Server].

classes.name: BasicImage
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [Attachment] class from libcrails-attachment which provides methods that help you resize or crop images to a given sizes.

classes.name: RequestJsonParser
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [RequestParser] interface that parses a body provided with the application/json format and stores it in the [Params] object.

classes.name: Mail
classes.excerpt: Represents an email with its various attributes: content, sender, recipients...

classes.name: MailServer
classes.excerpt: This class helps you define mail server configurations for the [MailServers] class.

classes.name: MailServiceInterface
classes.excerpt: The [MailServiceInterface] allows you to connect to a mail service and use it to send mails, without having to care about which backend you're using.

classes.name: MailServers
classes.excerpt: This singleton class is used to create instances of mail services, used to send mails through one of the provided backends.

classes.name: Mailer
classes.excerpt: The Mailer class helps you quickly rendering emails using Crails views.The relevant render methods provided in [Crails::RenderController] are alsoimplemented in the [Crails::Mailer] class.

classes.name: Session
classes.excerpt: Loads and stores the session data for an [AuthenticableModel] implementation using a query's [SessionStore].

classes.name: ProxyRequestHandler
classes.excerpt: Implementation of [RequestHandler] that filters queries matching a set of [ProxyRequestHandler::Rules] and treat them accordingly.

classes.name: ProxyRequest
classes.excerpt: Describes a request to be run by [ProxyRequestHandler]. It is returned by [Rule] using [ProxyRequestHandler::RuleSolver].

classes.name: Rule
classes.excerpt: Defines a pattern to match in a URI, as well as a policy or function defining how matching HTTP requests shall be treated.

classes.name: RenderFile
classes.excerpt: A [RenderTarget] implementation that forward rendered content to a file.

classes.name: AuthController
classes.excerpt: Controller component for access-protected content, where the access is granted to users that have an opened [Session]. The USER model should implement the [AuthenticableModel] component.

classes.name: AuthenticableModel
classes.excerpt: Model component for authenticable users. Models including this component can be used with [Session], [SessionController] and [AuthController].

classes.name: Password
classes.excerpt: Helper class to store and check encrypted passwords. It extends [std::string], but encrypts any content assigned to it using operator=.

classes.name: RequestUrlParser
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [RequestParser] interface which loads variables from URL parameters found in the [HttpRequest] included in the provided [Context].

classes.name: RequestXmlParser
classes.excerpt: Implementation of the [RequestParser] interface that parses a body provided with the application/xml or text/xml format, and stores it in the [Params] object.

classes.name: Variable
classes.excerpt: The [Variable] class represents any parameter or return value in the XML-RPC protocol, and gives you tools to easily convert them to native C++ types, or to directly interact with them.

classes.name: Controller
classes.excerpt: The [XmlRpc::Controller] class allows you to implement an XML-RPC endpoint that integrates within a Crails server and its [Crails::Router]. The functions you want to expose using the XML-RPC protocol a...

classes.name: Struct
classes.excerpt: The struct class helps you interact, send and receive <struct> elements from the XML-RPC protocol.

classes.name: Client
classes.excerpt: The [XmlRpc::Client] class allows you to call a remote function using the XML-RPC protocol using C++ semantics.

functions.name: defaults_to
functions.excerpt: Returns a value from [SharedVars], or fallbacks to a default value.

functions.name: getenv_as
functions.excerpt: Returns an environment variable as the specified type.

functions.name: uri
functions.excerpt: Builds an URI from a list of arguments. Each parameter will be URI-encoded and appended as a fragment of the newly built URI:

functions.name: exclude_nullptr
functions.excerpt: Takes a list of pointers as parameter, and returns a list of the same type cleared out of any null pointers.

functions.name: collect
functions.excerpt: Return a subset of an iterable list of objects or object pointers.

functions.name: exclude_nullptr
functions.excerpt: Takes a list of pointers as parameter, and returns a list of the same type cleared out of any null pointers.

functions.name: collect
functions.excerpt: Return a subset of an iterable list of objects or object pointers.
